content.raw: This is caused because `Plot::RemoveVariable()` is executed twice with the same `_id`. It seems a bit tricky but here's the sequence: `RemoveVariable()`->`this->dataPtr->yVariableContainer->RemoveVariablePill()`->`VariableRemoved()`->`OnRemoveVariableFromPill()`->`RemoveVariable()`. I'm not sure if this is expected (maybe @chapulina or @iche033 can chime in) but I've removed the error message for now. 7877b5d .
content.html: This is caused because Plot::RemoveVariable() is executed twice with the same _id. It seems a bit tricky but here's the sequence: RemoveVariable()->this->dataPtr->yVariableContainer->RemoveVariablePill()->VariableRemoved()->OnRemoveVariableFromPill()->RemoveVariable(). I'm not sure if this is expected (maybe @chapulina or @iche033 can chime in) but I've removed the error message for now. 7877b5d .

content.raw:
This has been addressed in branch `plot_4_single_canvas` which was merged into this one. Main changes:

* There is no longer the concept of multiple canvases, instead, the user can open multiple plot plugins
* The `Canvas` class has been removed and its functionality is now directly in the `Plot` plugin
* The `ExportDialog` has been removed, since its main goal was to manage exporting multiple canvases. I hesitated a lot before removing it because it looked cool and we put some time into making the tests pass, but I couldn't justify its existence without multiple canvases. Now exporting is done directly through "Export" buttons in the settings menu, It's worth mentioning that even though the `ExportDialog` handled multiple canvases at once, it was not combining the exported results in any way, so we didn't lose any functionality.
* Removed several functions which were only used in tests and changed the tests so that functionality is triggered the same way the user would trigger it. The previous tests were not corresponding to the real usage of the plugin.

Demo of `plot.config` with new functionality:

![plotsingle.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/788261392-plotsingle.gif)
content.html:
This has been addressed in branch plot_4_single_canvas which was merged into this one. Main changes:

  • There is no longer the concept of multiple canvases, instead, the user can open multiple plot plugins
  • The Canvas class has been removed and its functionality is now directly in the Plot plugin
  • The ExportDialog has been removed, since its main goal was to manage exporting multiple canvases. I hesitated a lot before removing it because it looked cool and we put some time into making the tests pass, but I couldn't justify its existence without multiple canvases. Now exporting is done directly through "Export" buttons in the settings menu, It's worth mentioning that even though the ExportDialog handled multiple canvases at once, it was not combining the exported results in any way, so we didn't lose any functionality.
  • Removed several functions which were only used in tests and changed the tests so that functionality is triggered the same way the user would trigger it. The previous tests were not corresponding to the real usage of the plugin.

Demo of plot.config with new functionality:
